column1: Rastatt is a Landkreis (district) in the west of Baden-Württemberg
column2: Germany. Neighbouring districts are (from north clockwise) Karlsruhe
column4: Freudenstadt and the Ortenaukreis. To the west it borders the French département Bas-Rhin. Rastatt completely surrounds the district-free city Baden-Baden.

column1: The district was created in 1939 as the successor of the Oberamt Rastatt and later the Großkreis Baden. In 1973 it was merged with the majority of the neighboring district Bühl
column2: and some small parts of the district Kehl.

column1: The district is located in the Rhine valley.  The south-east part
column3: is part of the Northern Black Forest. The highest elevation is the Hornisgrinde.

column1: The county has three small exclaves within the borough of Baden-Baden. The largest of these is home to the Waldenecksee
Since 1968 the district has partnership with the Finnish city Vantaa. The partnership with the Italian Provincia di Pesaro e Urbino was started in 1996.
It is twinned with Fano in Italy
column3: Connecticut in the USA and also twinned with Woking
column4: England in 2000. It is also twinned with the Czech town from which its Princess came from during the Baroque period and for whom the summer palace was built.
